intro: Ropalopetalum uniflorum, commonly known as the single-flowered rosalina, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the southeastern United States, particularly Florida and the coastal regions of Georgia. The plant is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrubs with small, leathery leaves that are typically dark green in color. It produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that are usually pink or white, blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
